Objects

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • Objects.Item
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Perishable

    public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    The Item class creates a new item.
    Author:
    Jake Ralph

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String name,
            double cost,
            double sellPrice,
            int reorderPoint,
            int reorderAmount)
        Creates an item
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the Item
        cost - Cost of the Item
        sellPrice - Re-sale price of the Item
        reorderPoint - Point at which new stock needs to be ordered at
        reorderAmount - Amount which needs to be ordered at the reorderPoint

      • getQuantity

        public int getQuantity()
        Used to get the Items current quantity of stock.
        Returns:
        the number of items in stock

      • sellItem

        public void sellItem(int quantitySold)
        Used for when an Item is sold. Takes the amount sold away from the current quantity.
        Parameters:
        quantitySold - The amount of an Item sold

      • receiveItem

        public void receiveItem(int quantityReceived)
        Used for when an order of items come in. Adds the amount of an Item, received and adds it to the current quantity.
        Parameters:
        quantityReceived - The amount to be added.
